intro: Lagenaria siceraria var. microcarpa, commonly known as the bottle gourd, is a flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical fruit that can be harvested at various stages of maturity. The plant produces large, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that are typically unisexual. The fruit is typically used for its edible young gourds or as a container when mature. It is native to Africa but is now cultivated in many parts of the world for both culinary and practical purposes.
